definition: chicken feather/CL:根[gen1]/trivial
fowl/chicken/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(slang) prostitute

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
surname Mao
lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
to wave a chicken feather as a token of authority (idiom); to assume unwarranted authority on the basis of some pretext
pinyin: na2 zhe5 ji1 mao2 dang4 ling4 jian4

definition: a simple inn with only chicken feathers to sleep on

sentences.english: During the war, our army often used letters attached with a chicken feather to deliver important messages.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭時期我軍經常用雞毛信傳遞重要信息。

sentences.english: Last week we got into this huge fight over the stupidest thing.
sentences.chinese: 上週我們因爲一點雞毛蒜皮的事大吵了一架。

sentences.english: She often hits the roof because of trifles.
sentences.chinese: 她常爲雞毛蒜皮的小事大發雷霆。

sentences.english: Small things that you do can make a huge impact on the world.
sentences.chinese: 你做的一件雞毛蒜皮的事也能對世界產生巨大的影響。

sentences.english: He said if I was elected, we’ll all be plucking chickens for a living.
sentences.chinese: 他說如果我當選的話，我們都得靠拔雞毛爲生。

sentences.english: Even trivial things can set Arthur and his wife at loggerheads.
sentences.chinese: 即使是雞毛蒜皮的小事也能使阿瑟和他妻子吵起來。

sentences.english: My mother tends to chatter over little things.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽總喜歡因爲雞毛蒜皮的小事碎碎念。

sentences.english: Duck feather chicken feather duck call to frown.
sentences.chinese: 鴨毛雞愁眉苦臉地給雞毛鴨打電話。

sentences.english: Talk people tend to fall into a non-trivial quarrel in the long-winded.
sentences.chinese: 議論別人往往陷入雞毛蒜皮的是非口舌中糾纏不清。

sentences.english: But microblogs in China are not just about trivia.
sentences.chinese: 但中國的微博並不僅僅侷限於雞毛蒜皮的小事兒。

sentences.english: Talking about others will make your trapped in ravelment by trifiles.
sentences.chinese: 議論別人往往陷入雞毛蒜皮的是非口舌中糾纏不清。

sentences.english: Feather duster is a useful tool for the thorough house-cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 雞毛撣子是大掃除中一種有用的工具。
不要爲這些雞毛蒜皮的事爭吵。

sentences.english: The flowerpots are made by reducing chicken feathers to a powder.
sentences.chinese: 要製造這種花盆，首先把雞毛弄成粉末。

sentences.english: Chicken Feathers, Stagecoaches and Telephone Lines.
sentences.chinese: 第二十一節雞毛信，騾車，電話線。
他們在一些雞毛蒜皮的小事上爭吵不休。

definition: to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
(dialect) wall brick
crotch of trousers
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
bandage (loanword)
to cry out in fear
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
damn thing/(not one's) goddamn business
to get angry/irritated/to annoy/to aggravate/annoying
to abuse roundly
hand gesture in traditional dances (joined thumb and middle finger, the rest extended)
short note/slip of paper/stripe/(slang) cop/(old) prostitute
to boil (of liquid)/boiling hot/Get out!/Go away!/fuck off (rude)
way/method/means/Taiwan pr. [fa1 r5]
